name: vscode-remote-mosh
description: Open any folder on a remote machine over Mosh (Mobile Shell) — survives network drops and IP roaming.

remoteMosh.defaultUser.description: Default SSH username for Mosh connections. If empty, the current system user is used.
remoteMosh.defaultUser.markdownDescription:
Default SSH username for Mosh connections. If empty, uses the current OS username.

Example: `ubuntu`

remoteMosh.defaultPort.description: Preferred UDP port for the Mosh connection (mosh-server will use this or the next available port in range 60001-61000).
remoteMosh.defaultPort.markdownDescription:
Preferred UDP port for the Mosh connection.

The `mosh-server` will use this port or the next available one in the range `60001–61000`.

Make sure this port range is open in your firewall.

remoteMosh.identityFile.description: Path to the SSH private key file (identity file) for authentication. If empty, SSH agent or default keys (~/.ssh/id_rsa etc.) are used.
remoteMosh.identityFile.markdownDescription:
Path to the SSH private key file used for authentication.

Example: `~/.ssh/id_ed25519`

Leave empty to use the SSH agent or default key files (`~/.ssh/id_rsa`, `~/.ssh/id_ed25519`, etc.).

remoteMosh.serverPath.description: Path to the mosh-server binary on the remote host.
remoteMosh.serverPath.markdownDescription:
Path to the `mosh-server` binary on the **remote** host.

Example: `/usr/bin/mosh-server`

remoteMosh.mtu.description: UDP MTU (bytes) for the Mosh transport. Use 500 for mobile/unstable networks, 1400 for stable LAN.
remoteMosh.mtu.markdownDescription:
UDP MTU (bytes) for the Mosh transport.

- **500** (default): Mobile / unstable Wi-Fi / VPN
- **1400**: Stable wired LAN

remoteMosh.logLevel.description: Log verbosity for the Remote-Mosh extension output channel.
